name: Transformer, Beastmaster Warrior Shapechanger, AKA Monk 6/Ranger 9/Druid 25. Help please.
author: Asturonethoriusaline

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Ok it may not look like it but this is a strength, wisdom, non dex build, highly Modified AB build.

The goal is to get LOTS of attacks as a Dragon using Monk unarmed flurry of blows, Ranger 9th level 2 weapon path up to improved 2 weapon fighting, and tacking on cleave and great cleave as well to do about 13 attacks per round as a Dragon with a 48 strength.

Now this kind of build might be easy for a lot of you, but its kind of tricky for me.

Where I need help?:

1,2 Epic Feats, which to choose, Armor Skin?, Epic Prowess? Something else.

And I get 1,2 bonus feats from list of:

Epic Spell focus, Epic Spell penetration, Auto quicken, Auto Still(No Verbal required), Auto the one that says no hands required, Epic Energy Existence

So I dont know which 1,2 to take from that list.

I used the CBC, Character Build Calculator

Its in Excel Spreadsheet.

But I cant output it in a nice organized way using my smartphone.

So I am sharing the CBC file link to the build here.

The skills are only half done, as I pretty much got the skills figured out, but still open to improvement, optimization, and would like some optimization help with the toon overall.

So here is the CBC build:

I am sharing 'CBC284.2.xlsx' with you from OneDrive - Personal
Hi,

Here's the link to the file:

https://1drv.ms/x/s!AgoAb77y3xGrcY4NlodY8QU3Ezc

Shared from Excel for Android
https://office.com/getexcel

Also if I can get some help to where I can get Monk level 6, and Ranger levels 6 and 9, and Druid level 18 earlier then 33rd lev, and Dragon Shape earlier then 33 rd to 36th lev, where I get all of the above at a much earlier, at least semi optimized lev early, and get to have all that, earlier, and have my cake, and be able to eat it all too, etc, it would be greatly appreciated.

For those who either cant see the link, etc, Pre Epic Split is Monk 6/Ranger 6/Druid 8

And the post epic split is:

Monk 6/Ranger 9/Druid 25

Base Stats 30 points

Elf

Str 14, Dex 14, Con 10, Wis 16, Int 14, Cha 8

14 str for early lev AB, damage, and Power Attack, Great Cleave.

Dex 14 for:

A. Early Ranged AB(For survivability), wearing Med Armor like Chainmail(AC +5, max dex bonus +2, until either animal, monster, Dragon, Monk Unarmed AC, etc,  exceeds magical +8 chainmail AC

B. For dex based feat that require a 13

Con 10: dont need higher con because about 333 hp at 40th lev, and dragon Con is about 35 to 40, etc.

Wisdom at 16 to be able to get to required 30 wisdom for Dragon Change.

Int 14: for more skill points, and a 13 for Expertise, etc.

Feats

1st lev Power Attack

Cleave(From Monk)

3rd lev Great Cleave

6th lev Weapon Focus Unarmed strike, can use monk fist attacks, flurry, as a dragon

9th lev Expertise

12 lv Extend

15 improved critical unarmed strike, can use monk fist attacks, flurry, as a dragon

18th lv blind fight

Knockdown, improved knockdown(Monk)

Two Weapon fighting, Ambidexterity, Improved 2 weapon fighting(9 levels of Ranger), monk fist, flurry, unarmed strike count as weapons for 2 weapon fighting, and unarmed flurry, unarmed 2 weapon attack, can be used as a dragon, to go with your other dragon attacks as a dragon

4, 5 great wisdoms

4th lev stat increases, all to wisdom

1 epic slot(Dont know what to take, altho leaning towards 3 to 6 feats)

1 epic bonus slot(Dont know what to take).

Thanks for any help with this build.

Mike

[skill outline truncated]
Overall this is an ambitious build to create a dual kama monk that can turn into a dragon. 
Your major challenge with this build is going to be the Attack Bonus in Monk form. 
The Base AB in the build unfortunately is quite low at 29. It is further weakened by dual wielding kamas (-2 AB) and using flurry of blows (-2 AB). 
Druids can cap strength easily (Bull's Strength, Blood Frenzy, Aura of Vitality) for +6 AB but even still the AB is going to be a struggle. Other classes such as clerics, and bards can boost the effective AB even further than a druid can. Unfortunately I do not see a lot of solutions apart from dropping Dragon Shape and investing stats into Str (or Dex + Weapon Finesse) to boost AB up that way. 

On the flipside, in Dragon Shape your AB should be good enough with BAB 26 + druid buffs, as long as your buffs are not dispelled.

Regarding dragon shape -> once you polymorph (into a dragon for example) would it be fair to say you can no longer dual wield on Arkhalia? Or has this been modified?

A Monk 4 / Ranger 8 / Druid 8 split would net you +1 AB, you can then get improved knockdown at level 22.
With a high Wis score, your grease spells can provide an AoE knockdown which you are immune to.

Pre-epic feats I would swap improved critical: heavy flail to improved critical: unarmed. This is because creature weapons use Improved Critical but not Weapon foci.
Epic feats I would try to fit epic prowess, which polymorphs (creature weapons) will use. Epic Weapon Focus: Kama might be useful if you want to have a useful kama attack. Unfortunately as discussed WF: Unarmed and EWF: Unarmed do not transfer to polymorphs
One could drop Int slightly and increase cons if you find you have too many skill points.

Anyway hope thats helpful.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
In vanilla NWN dual-wielding does not work while shifted, but I assume that this has been changed on your server. WF/EWF/WS/EWS: Unarmed also don't work while shifted in vanilla NWN either, but if that has been modified on your server then you can easily fit them in.

If you're building for level 40 then I would suggest either Dru24/Figh10/Monk6 or Dru24/Rang10/Monk6. The Dru24/Figh10/Monk6 can get Dragon Shape at level 36, the Dru24/Rang10/Monk6 can get Dragon Shape at level 33. The pre-epic spreads for the builds are Dru8/Figh8/Monk4 and Dru8/Rang8/Monk4 respectively.

Ignore Great Cleave, Cleave should be enough unless you will be fighting hordes of weak monsters. If WF/EWF doesn't work while shifted on your server then the epic feats for both builds are Armor Skin, Dragon Shape, Epic Prowess, and G WIS 6. This can easily be changed to include EWF for both builds, although it might mean delaying Dragon Shape. The Figh variant can also get both WS and EWS if that works while shifted.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
To Clarify, I am using unarmed strike. So I am improved critical unarmed strike and weapon focus unarmed strike.

The improved critical heavy flail thing was when I clicked on improved critical in CBC, I just clicked a random improved critical. I just didnt want to take the time to find the improved critical unarmed strike option.

So not dual wielding Kama's. Unarmed strike fist count as 2 weapons right? If so, then doing 2 weapon fighting with fist.

If that cant be done, then I'll use Kama's for 2 weapon fighting.

As to the low AB, I was going to use the earlier forms like Bear: 28 to 38 str, and buffs, and summons, and spells and good play to get by, around that, and maybe using a party, or doing the easier PW's, or the easier official campaign modules.

Yunim, what would you substitute for Power Attack, Great Cleave.

Thanks for the help, suggestions Orion, Yunim, I will either do or try to do most to almost all those suggestions.

I really like the concept of having lots of animal companions, lots of animals, monsters I can summon, being able to change into various animals, monsters, shapes, etc.

I know that shifter would probably be better then this, but I would lose out on the Ranger extra animal companion, better BAB schedule, better D10 hp, 2 weapon path.

I could do the Monk/Druid/Shifter, and just take use feat slots to get the 2 weapon feats, but I would lose out even more with, on the AB, and lose the extra animal companion, and only have 1 animal companion, instead of 2 animal companions.

I thought I read, saw, that if you were a monk, that your monk unarmed attacks, AC, etc, became part of your dragon form, and that that was why Monk/Druid/Shifter/Dragon Form was good.

Did I mishear, misread, misunderstand that?

Also even tho some good advice from Yunim, Orion, is there anybody here that is a expert builder of Dragon Shape toons that could help here?

Thanks for the help.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content: Also the reason why I have to do a dual WIS/STR build instead of WIS/DEX, is that I can lose my dex bonus to AC, with this build. Its harder to lose str bonus, and Wisdom Bonus.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The only weapon feats that work for unarmed wildshape forms in vanilla NWN are Epic Prowess and IC: Unarmed. DC/EWF/EWS/OC/WF/WS: Unarmed will not work while shifted.
Unarmed attacks count as single-wielding, you need to actually use two weapons or a double-sided weapon in order to dual-wield.
In vanilla NWN the monk bonuses do count while shifted, although some servers change this so it might be different on your server.

A Dru24/Rang10/Monk6 will only have one level 24 companion, you won't get an extra one from Rang10. Any druid build can have a companion, a summon, and use Animal Empathy for a total party count of four. If you want another party member then a Dru18/Wiz21/Monk1 will have both a level 18 companion and a level 21 familiar.

I would swap Great Cleave for Improved Expertise, I take it in almost all of my dragon builds. Dragons already have high AC but a situational +10 AC can let them AC tank against most mobs in low/medium magic worlds. Zen Archery is another choice that gives you a ranged option while unshifted. Your ranged AB will be much higher than your melee AB when unshifted.

The main benefits Dru/Shif/Monk dragons have over other dragon builds is that their breath weapon is more effective and they also have access to other forms. There are a lot of effective dragon builds so I can't really recommend a specific build. Even a caster druid can take Dragon Shape without focusing on it and still be a decent dragon.

I agree with Orion2019 that you should either focus on dual-wielding or Dragon form, not both.

I can see why from what you said why taking 10 ranger levels, is worthless to the concept, build.

No extra animal companion for getting to ranger level 6. And 2 weapon fighting, lots of attacks doesnt seem to game mechanically within the rules, doesnt seem to mesh well with dragon shape.

So because of that, I wilp go with Monk/Druid/Shifter, with either a Monk 6/Druid 18/Shifter 16(INFINITE Greater Wild Shape 4, Dire Tiger, Medusa, Illithid Mind Flayer), and can use either a epic feat, or bonus feat for Dragon Shape

Or Monk 6/Druid 24(Near undispellable spells, and near maxed out spellcasting)/Shifter 10(Dragon Shape)

Pre Epic for both possibilities would be either Monk 6/Druid 6/Shifter 8, or Monk 4/Druid 8/Shifter 8.

If I go with Str 10/12, and bump base starting wis to 17,18, then I can take Dragon Shape by Level 30, instead of lev 33, by going Great Wis at levels 21, 24,27(30 Wis), then take Dragon Shape feat at 30th level, instead of lev 33 to 36.

Improved Expertise and Zen Archery, sounds good. If I take it tho, should I also take point blank shot?

Also there is a LOT of Magic Weapons, up to +8 on Arkhalia. But I havent seen a lot of +8, etc, high magic bows or Crossbows, and havent seen a lot of +8, etc, arrows, +8, etc, bolts, etc.

There is a LOT of +1 to +8 melee weapons tho.

Ranged Weapons, high +1 to +8, magic weapons, and the fact that I could transform to a 27 str Brown bear by 7th level by going Monk 2/Druid 5, would make a lower AB, work ok, just fine, until I get better forms, a dragon

So which split would you advise Monk 6/Druid 18/Shifter 16 or Monk 6/Druid 24/Shifter 10 or some other split? Which?

Thanks

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content: Also altho you said WF, EWF unarmed doesnt work while shifted into a dragon, but does WF, EWF Kama, work while in dragon form?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
For Dragon Shape builds, I'd suggest Druid 24+ (for undispellable buffs) and Monk 1+, anything else depends on what you want in the build.

Here's a few builds you might be interested in reading:
Nature's Wyrm by Kail Pendragon, it gets Dragon Shape at level 28.
Champion of the Wilderness  by Maximillan Kane, DS at level 31
The Skilled and Sneaky Draconian Arch-Druid by Orion, DS at level 30
The Wild Heart focused Rakhasa/Dragon shifter by Goshozal, Rakhasa shape at 33, DS at 36.

To read more about what feats work in Dragon Shape and what doesn't, have a look at the NWN Wiki Article.
Sometimes things are modified you will need to check with Arkhalia if it has. Otherwise it will be as per the NWN Wiki article.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
So here is the CBC build.

I found a way to get Shifter 10th lev Infinite Greater Wildshape 4 by on 16th level. That means by 16th level can be a Mind Flayer, Medusa, Dire Tiger.

And by 30th lev, can be a Dragon.

Split:

Pre Epic

Monk 4/Druid 6/Shifter 10

Post Epic

Monk 6/Druid 18/Shifter 16

Going with a post epic split of

Monk 6/Druid 24/Shifter 10 makes itvso that get to Dragon at 33rd level, instead of Level 30.

I'd rather get to Dragon by Lev 30, go with Druid 18, then Druid 24, lev 33 dragon.

I know that can leave open to buffs, spells being countered, dispelled, not getting thru.

But as a Dragon, get SR 24, thats going to be extremely hard to penetrate to dispell buffs, etc.

And even if get thru all that to dispel, the Dragon is awesome enough at 800 hp, 48 strength, etc, that can easily still win.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Ok started playing this build.

Only a couple minor changes:

1. Stats:

Str 10, Dex 14, Con 8, Wis 18, Cha 8.

Went with this because dont want Str at 8, because that make it hard to even deal damage when hit in melee.

And need a 14 dex, 12 not enough. And the bear form that get at lev 6, gives you about a 19, 20 con.

Went with either Point blank shot, or WF Heavy Crossbow, to go with Zen Archery.

Animal Companion, Summons in early levels Kill EVERYTHING for you, and later on help give you time to take care of foes via Crossbow, Spells, etc.

Then at 6th level can turn into a Bear with 82 HP, +11 AB, STR 27, Con 19, 20, and turn into a killing machine.

That's good enough by itself, but can buff yourself, then summon your Brown Bear Animal Companion, and Summon a Boar, then change into a Bear. Then the 3 of you DESTROY EVERYTHING.

So Low BAB, AB, Str, Con is NOT a problem with this build.

And when your 1 hour per druid lev expires, and change back again, and cant change into a bear again, can either just either rest, sleep, rhen change into a bear again, or whip out your crossbow to go with your 2,3 animals(1 companion, 1 summon, 1 animal empathy).

And the more powerful forms become available with going up levels, and being able to use forms more times per day, before rest, goes up with going up druidic levels.

I might hit a wall later, but for now, this build is extremely powerful.

Also its just a lot of fun, cool, awesome, to turn into some like a bear, and have all your animal friends do the work

Also I remember somebody saying that your animal companion, summons will take some of your XP. I checked into this, and I havent seen this.

In fact I seem to get more xp, level up faster with this build(wasnt expecting that

Thanks for the help.

Mike

Oh and my AC is about 25,26 in Bear form, after merging my Monk AC, Magic AC gear, AC, Dex, WIS, etc, Buffs into Bear form.

So 11 AB, 25 AC, 1D8 + Str Bonus(Claw), 2D8 + Str Bonus{Bite), 2 attacks per round. Still get to use Monk Cleave Class feat in Bear form, etc, all at 6th level.
